title: euv1.png
description:
This image is a screenshot of a computer terminal, displaying a command-line interface with a dark background and light green text. The terminal seems to be showing the process of a software package installation or update, likely on a Linux-based system.

In the top section of the screen, there's a list of package names like "extra/haskell," "extra/python-certifi," and "extra/vulkan-radeon," along with version numbers and file sizes. The columns are titled "Package," "Version," "Installed Size," and "Net Upgrade Size."

Below this list, a message reads "Proceed with installation? [Y/n] y," indicating the user has been prompted to confirm the installation and has entered 'y'.

The bottom part of the screen shows the progress of "Retrieving packages..." There's a list of file names, download speeds, and progress bars. The numbers "2/45" suggest that two out of 45 packages have been processed.

The overall aesthetic is that of a minimalist, text-based operating system or a development environment. The screen also has a status bar at the very top, showing information like battery level, network connection, time, and system resources.
